transcript_segments.text: Today we’ll teach you how to make Mughal Darbar-style chicken biryani at home using a rice cooker. If you’ve ever tried Mughal Darbar’s biryani, you probably liked it. That’s why this recipe was highly requested.

Please share your feedback on our Facebook and Instagram pages, Kashmir Food Fusion. This biryani turns out very tasty and is a bit different from regular biryani, but still delicious. First, let’s look at the ingredients we've used.
We soaked the chicken in vinegar and salt water. This helps it become soft, tender, and clean. Then we used nutmeg and mace — both are essential in this recipe.
First, we’ll take a pressure cooker, add water, and put in the remaining chicken parts like the neck, back, and waist — parts that aren't great for eating in biryani. We’ll extract stock from them.
We had powdered nutmeg and mace — one each. Here's a pinch going in now, the rest will be added later in the recipe.

Now I'm adding MSG or monosodium glutamate, also known as Chinese salt — just a pinch, to enhance the flavor. It’s commonly used in restaurant-style recipes. After extracting the stock, we’ll cook the chicken separately in another pan.
We’re adding cloves (3), green cardamom (3), bay leaf (1), and turmeric powder (half a teaspoon).

Now I’m adding a pinch of red food color. This gives the chicken its signature reddish color. Boil this on high flame for about five minutes. After that, drain the water and keep the chicken aside for frying.
